title: Planning and designing a shelterbelt - lessons learnt from the Pinery fire

tasks.task: Establish shelter belts and windbreaks on a property
subtasks: Determine the purpose and benefits desired from the shelter belt (e.g., animal shelter, fire protection, crop benefits)
Research and select appropriate local tree species for the shelter belt
Time ripping and weed control activities a year in advance of planting
Choose the optimal planting season (pre-break of the season in April or Autumn) for establishing trees
Plan the structure of the shelter belt (e.g., five rows with small shrubs on the outside and larger trees in the center)
Ensure proper placement of shelter belts perpendicular to prevailing winds to reduce wind speeds and erosion
Consider permeability of the shelter belt to prevent wind tunnel effects
Source and acquire plants from local nurseries or government programs (e.g., Brosserbush Gardens, free native plants)
Prepare the soil by ripping to improve subsoil moisture and root development
Install tree guards and stakes to protect young trees during establishment
